description: Mentioned only by Grove and Williams, who say: �usually ... a 2' reed of soft Trumpet tone, sometimes a bass-half stop only.� The known examples contradict this definition (see below); the only 2' Clarines we know of are named Clarines en Quincena. Examples Clarines 8', Organo Mayor (right); Parroquia, Santanyí, Baleares, Spain; Bosch 1800's. Clarines 8', Organo Mayor (right, en chamade); Convento de Sant Agusti, Palma de Mallorca, Baleares, Spain; Caimari 1700's. Clarines 4', Organo Mayor (left, en chamade); Convento de Sant Agusti, Palma de Mallorca, Baleares, Spain; Caimari 1700's. Clarines 8', Cadereta Interior (right); San Sebastian, Antequera, Malaga, Spain; Muñoz 1735. Bibliography Grove[1]: Clarin. Williams[1]: Glossary: Clarin. FOOTER Original site compiled by Edward L. Stauff. For educational use only. Clarines.html - Last updated 22 May 2000. Home Full Index
